sentences.english: The Central Government hereby expresses its satisfaction and appreciation for the remarkable achievements that you have made.
sentences.chinese: 中央政府对你们取得的显著政绩，表示满意和赞赏。

sentences.english: However, those credentials are not likely to lead to victory in Wednesday's vote.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这些政绩不大可能使其在周三的选举中获胜。

sentences.english: To be acquainted with the merit of ministry, we need only observe the condition of the people.
sentences.chinese: 要了解政府的政绩只需要观察民情。

sentences.english: Here is a comment on the achievements during his tenure of Liang Jiang Provincial Governor.
sentences.chinese: 本文仅就其在两江总督任内的政绩作评述。

sentences.english: Our party repeatedly emphasize that leading cadre must set up correct view of achievement in post.
sentences.chinese: 我们党一再强调，领导干部要树立正确的政绩观。

sentences.english: He put our love as the affairs of his state.
sentences.chinese: 他把我们的事情当成了他的国事和政绩。

sentences.english: This news has also been regarded as the greatest diplomatic achievement for the Ma Government term.
sentences.chinese: 这个消息也被视为马政府任内最大外交政绩。

sentences.english: The Gilligan record in four years as governor was exemplary.
sentences.chinese: 吉利根当州长四年，政绩斐然。

sentences.english: The village and town level of administration ability is one of the criteria to judge the achievement of grass-root-level government.
sentences.chinese: 而乡镇政府能力是评价基层政府政绩的标准之一。

definition: style of governing (of minor official)/achievement in office
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
to take an official post/to become a government employee
to rejoice in grandiose deeds/to strive to achieve extraordinary things
